sitesupport:
Display name for the 'Donations' page, shown in the sidebar menu of all pages. The target page is meant to be the page where users can see how they can contribute financially to the wiki site.

{{Identical|Donate}}
tooltip-n-sitesupport: The tooltip when hovering over the {{msg-mw|sitesupport}} link in the sidebar.
specialpages-group-contribution: {{doc-special-group|that=are related to the extensions ContributionReporting and LandingCheck|like=[[Special:ContributionHistory]], [[Special:ContributionTotal]], [[Special:ContributionStatistics]], [[Special:FundraiserStatistics]], [[Special:ContributionTrackingStatistics]], [[Special:LandingCheck]]}}
nstab-creator:
Text on the tab of pages in the "Creator" namespace on Wikimedia Commons ([[commons:Creator:Heinrich_Hoerle|Example]])
{{Identical|Creator}}
nstab-institution:
Text on the tab of pages in the "Institution" namespace on Wikimedia Commons ([[commons:Institution:Wallraf-Richartz-Museum|Example]])
{{Identical|Institution}}
nstab-sequence:
Text on the tab of pages in the "Sequence" namespace on Wikimedia Commons ([[commons:Sequence:Cats|Example]]).
{{Identical|Sequence}}
nstab-timedtext: Text on the tab of pages in the "TimedText" namespace on Wikimedia Commons ([[commons:TimedText:Edit_Button.ogv.en.srt|Example]])
group-otrs-member-member:
{{doc-group|otrs-member|member}}

The initial letter of messages of this type is usually lowercase.
group-bigexport:
{{doc-group|bigexport}}
Big export user has a right to: {{int:right-override-export-depth}}
group-bigexport-member:
{{doc-group|bigexport|member}}
Big export user has a right to: {{int:Right-override-export-depth}}
grouppage-bigexport:
{{doc-group|bigexport|page}}
Big export user has a right to: {{int:right-override-export-depth}}
group-eliminator:
{{doc-group|eliminator}}
Usergroup introduced for ptwiki ([[w:pt:Especial:Lista_de_privil%C3%A9gios_de_grupos|Especial:Lista de privilégios de grupos]], [[phab:T26623|Task T26623]])
group-eventparticipant:
{{doc-group|eventparticipant}}
Usergroup introduced for zhwiki ([[phab:T198167|Task T198167]]). It is granted to those who are editing at a Wiki course.
group-extendedconfirmed:
{{doc-group|extendedconfirmed}}
Usergroup introduced for enwiki ([[phab:T126607|Task T126607]]). It is automatically granted to users with accounts older than 30 days with 500 edits, and potentially manually granted to other editors, and carries the right to edit pages protected to a new level.
group-patroller:
{{doc-important|The translation of this message cannot be the same as {{msg-mw|group-checkuser}}}}
{{doc-group|patroller|prefix=wmf-}}
tag-emoji: Name for a change tag. Shown in diffs and revision lists next to edits which have been tagged by an abuse filter, and on [[Special:Tags]].
tag-emoji-description: Long description for a change tag. Shown on [[Special:Tags]].
tag-AWB:
{{optional}}

Name for a change tag. Shown in diffs and revision lists next to edits which have been tagged as being made by AutoWikiBrowser, and on [[Special:Tags]].
tag-AWB-description: Long description for a change tag. Shown on [[Special:Tags]].
search-interwiki-custom:
{{doc-important|Please do not translate this only within a single line, even if you're translating this to East Asian languages (i.e. Chinese, Japanese, Korean and their dialects).}} Friendly sister project site names in search results, one project name per line, in an ''iwprefix'':''caption'' format. For example, possible settings for the English Wikipedia are: wikt:Word definitions from Wiktionary
b:In Wikibooks
n:In Wikinews
q:Quotes from Wikiquote
s:From Wikisource
v:From Wikiversity
voy:In Wikivoyage
wikimedia-styles-exclude:
{{notranslate}}
Configurable by site admins to disable certain helper styles. [[mw:Extension:WikimediaMessages#wikimedia-styles-exclude|More information]]
wikimedia-copyright: This message is displayed in the site footer. It is the default licensing policy for most Wikimedia sites. Replace "Policy:Terms_of_Use" in the URL with "Special:MyLanguage/Policy:Terms_of_Use/''your_language''", for example, "Special:MyLanguage/Policy:Terms_of_Use/fr" for French.
wikimedia-commons-copyright: This message is displayed in the site footer. It is the special licensing policy for the Wikimedia Commons project. The values of the attribute "title" – "Definition of the Creative Commons CC0 License", "Definition of the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License", "Wikimedia Foundation Terms of Use", and "Wikimedia Foundation Privacy Policy" – should also be translated. Replace 'Terms_of_Use' and 'Privacy_policy' in the URL with 'Terms_of_Use/''your_language''' and 'Privacy_policy/''your_language''', for example, 'Terms_of_Use/fr' and 'Privacy_policy/fr' for French, if they exist.
mediawiki.org-copyright: This message is displayed in the site footer. It is the special licensing policy for the MediaWiki.org project. The values of the attribute "title" – "Definition of the Creative Commons CC0 License", "Definition of the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License", "Wikimedia Foundation Terms of Use", and "Wikimedia Foundation Privacy Policy" – should also be translated. Replace 'Terms_of_Use' and 'Privacy_policy' in the URL with 'Terms_of_Use/''your_language''' and 'Privacy_policy/''your_language''', for example, 'Terms_of_Use/fr' and 'Privacy_policy/fr' for French, if they exist.
mediawiki.org-copyrightwarning:
* Warning: the correct default licenses links are to the creativecommons.org ([https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/] or e.g. [https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/deed.fr] and https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/ or e.g. [https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/deed.fr]) and fsf.org ([https://www.gnu.org/copyleft/fdl.html]) pages, which should be used in the translations to languages other than English. Customisation may be possible on local wikis upon community consensus.
* Replace Terms_of_Use in the URL with Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/''your_language'', for example, Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/fr for French.
* You can translate the terms of use at [[m:Terms of use]] and link that version instead, if no translation is available on foundation.wikimedia.org.

Refers to {{msg-mw|publishchanges}}.
mediawiki.org-mobile-license-links: MediaWiki.org license link message fragment that appears in the mobile editor. This is used inside the {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-editor-licensing-with-terms}} message.
wikidata-copyright: This message is displayed in the site footer. It is the special licensing policy for the Wikidata project. The attribute "title" values ("Definition of the Creative Commons CC0 License", "Definition of the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License" and "Wikimedia Foundation Terms of Use") are also translatable. Replace Terms_of_Use in the URL with Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/''your_language'', for example, Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/fr for French.
wikidata-mobile-license-links: Wikidata license links that appear in the mobile editor. This message must not mention the GFDL; otherwise, it is the same as {{msg-mw|wikimedia-mobile-license-links}}.
wikimedia-copyrightwarning:
* Warning: the correct default licenses links are to the creativecommons.org ([https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/] or e.g. [https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/deed.fr]) and fsf.org ([https://www.gnu.org/copyleft/fdl.html]) pages, which should be used in the translations to languages other than English. Customisation may be possible on local wikis upon community consensus.
* Replace Terms_of_Use in the URL with Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/''your_language'', for example, Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/fr for French.
* You can translate the terms of use at [[m:Terms of use]] and link that version instead, if no translation is available on foundation.wikimedia.org.

Refers to {{msg-mw|Savearticle}}.
wikimedia-copyrightwarning-ccbysa40only:
This message must not mention the GFDL; otherwise, it is the same as {{msg-mw|wikimedia-copyrightwarning}}.

* Warning: the correct default licenses links are to the creativecommons.org ([https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/] or e.g. [https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/deed.fr]) pages, which should be used in the translations to languages other than English. Customisation may be possible on local wikis upon community consensus.
* Replace Terms_of_Use in the URL with Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/''your_language'', for example, Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/fr for French.
* You can translate the terms of use at [[m:Terms of use]] and link that version instead, if no translation is available on foundation.wikimedia.org.

Refers to {{msg-mw|Savearticle}}.
wikinews-mobile-license-links:
{{notranslate}}
Wikinews license links that appear in the mobile editor.
wikinews-mobile-license-links-ccby30:
{{notranslate}}
Wikinews license links that appear in the mobile editor.
wikifunctions-site-footer-copyright: This message is displayed in the site footer. It is the special licensing policy for the Wikifunctions project. The attribute "title" values ("Definition of the Creative Commons CC0 License", "Definition of the Apache 2.0 License", "Definition of the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License" and "Wikimedia Foundation Terms of Use") are also translatable. Replace Terms_of_Use in the URL with Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/''your_language'', for example, Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use/fr for French.
wikifunctions-edit-copyrightwarning-func: This is the special message shown when you edit a Wikifunctions function definition page. The link to creativecommons.org should be used in translations. This is a raw HTML message. See also {{msg-mw|wikifunctions-edit-copyrightwarning-implementation}}.
wikifunctions-edit-copyrightwarning-impl: This is the special message shown when you edit a Wikifunctions function implementation page. The link to apache.org should be used in translations. This is a raw HTML message. See also {{msg-mw|wikifunctions-edit-copyrightwarning-function}}.
wikifunctions-mobile-license-links: Wikifunctions license links that appear in the mobile editor for wikitext pages. It should be the same as {{msg-mw|wikidata-mobile-license-links}}.

cant-delete-main-page: Message shown if user attempts to delete or move the main page.
wikimedia-translationnotifications-signu: Legal text about the notifications sent to translators. Replace Privacy_policy in the URL with Special:MyLanguage/Privacy_policy/''your_language'', for example, Special:MyLanguage/Privacy_policy/fr for French.
upload-more-photos-of-this-monument: This message is added by the WLM app linking to the upload wizard with the parameters set for a new upload of the same monument.
createacct-captcha-help-url:
The URL of a page providing CAPTCHA assistance for the wiki.

Used as a link in the {{msg-mw|Createacct-imgcaptcha-help}} message on WMF wikis.
wikimedia-developers:
Label for a link to [[mw:How to contribute]] in the page footer. "Developer" means "software developer", not editor or contributor; feel free to replace the word with another which can be used in your language to call people with technical interest.

{{Identical|Developer}}
wikimedia-developers-url:
{{notranslate}}
The URL of a portal page for development efforts.
wikimedia-globalblocking-ipblocked:
A message shown to a [[mw:Extension:GlobalBlocking|globally blocked]] user trying to edit.

It is a customised version of {{msg-mw|globalblocking-ipblocked}}.

This message is similar to a [[MediaWiki:Blockedtext|MediaWiki core message]].

Parameters:
* $1 - the username of the blocking user (steward), with a link
* $2 - the project name where the blocking user is registered (usually "meta.wikimedia.org" on Wikimedia servers)
* $3 - the reason specified by the blocking user
* $4 - a timestamp for when the block was set
* $5 - a timestamp for when the block will expire (or {{msg-mw|Infiniteblock}})
* $6 - the IP address of the globally blocked user

Refers to:
* {{msg-mw|wikimedia-globalblocking-blockedtext-all-wikis}}
* {{msg-mw|blockedtext-include-details-queries}}
* {{msg-mw|wikimedia-globalblocking-blockedtext-mistake}}
wikimedia-globalblocking-ipblocked-range:
A message shown to a [[mw:Extension:GlobalBlocking|globally blocked]] user trying to edit through a globally blocked IP range.

Refers to {{msg-mw|Emailuser}} and is a customised version of {{msg-mw|globalblocking-ipblocked-range}}.

This message is similar to a [[MediaWiki:Blockedtext|MediaWiki core message]].

Parameters:
* $1 - the username of the blocking user (steward), with a link
* $2 - the project name where the blocking user is registered (usually "meta.wikimedia.org" on Wikimedia servers)
* $3 - the reason specified by the blocking user
* $4 - a timestamp for when the block was set
* $5 - a timestamp for when the block will expire (or {{msg-mw|Infiniteblock}})
* $6 - the IP address of the globally blocked user
* $7 - the IP range being affected by the global block.
wikimedia-torblock-blocked:
Used as error message; it is a modified version of {{msg-mw|torblock-blocked}}.
Parameters:
* $1 - IP address
wikimedia-mobile-frontend-terms-url:
{{optional}}
Terms of use link on the mobile site. Replace Terms_of_Use in the URL with Terms_of_Use/<your_language>, for example, Terms_of_Use/fr for French.
wikimedia-oauth-privacy-link:
Wikitext link pointing to the WMF privacy policy for all sites. Replace Privacy_policy in the URL with Privacy_policy/''your_language'' if a translation exists, for example, MyLanguage/Privacy_policy/fr for French.
{{Identical|Privacy policy}}
upload-form-label-own-work-message-commo: [[File:Cross-wiki media upload dialog, December 2015 AB test option 1.png|thumb]] Legal message, confirming that the user is allowed to upload the file.
upload-form-label-not-own-work-message-c: [[File:Cross-wiki media upload dialog, December 2015 AB test option 1.png|thumb]] Explains alternatives when the copyright isn't owned by the uploader.
upload-form-label-not-own-work-local-com: [[File:Cross-wiki media upload dialog, December 2015 AB test option 1.png|thumb]] Message suggesting the user might want to upload a file locally instead of to Wikimedia Commons.
wikimedia-upload-nolicenses:
This error is shown on [[Special:Upload]] on Wikimedia wikis when no license options are configured on [[MediaWiki:Licenses]].

See also [[mw:Manual:Image administration]].
interlanguage-link-sitename-mul: Part of the title (tooltip) text used for a language link (in the sidebar) to a multilingual version of the site, such as [[wikisource:|Multilingual Wikisource]].
interlanguage-link-sitename-wikipedia:
Part of the title (tooltip) text used for a sidebar link to a relevant page on Wikipedia. The text "the free encyclopedia" is the tagline of Wikipedia, and should be translated according to what is used on your language's edition of Wikipedia.

Comments:
* The word "free" must be in the sense of "liberated" and not in the sense of "it costs zero dollars". See the page [[:w:en:Wikipedia:The Free Encyclopedia|Wikipedia:The Free Encyclopedia]].
* You can spell the word "Wikipedia" according to the rules of your language.
* You can write the word "encyclopedia" in any way that feels right in your language. Some languages use the English word, some spell it differently according to their rules, and some invent a whole new word. Note that and encyclopedia is different from a dictionary. To be sure, check the Wikipedia article [[:w:en:Encyclopedia|Encyclopedia]].
interlanguage-link-sitename-commons: Title text (tooltip) used for a sidebar link to a relevant page on Wikimedia Commons.
interlanguage-link-sitename-dmoz: Part of the title (tooltip) text used for a sidebar link to a relevant page on [http://www.dmoz.org DMOZ].
interlanguage-link-sitename-citizendium:
{{optional}}
Part of the title (tooltip) text used for a sidebar link to a relevant page on [http://en.citizendium.org Citizendium].
right-superprotect:
{{doc-right|superprotect}}
Super protection right given to only "staff".
restriction-level-superprotect: Used on [[Special:ProtectedPages]] and [[Special:ProtectedTitles]]. An option in the drop-down box 'Restriction level' and in brackets after each page name entry.
restriction-level-templateeditor: Used on [[Special:ProtectedPages]] and [[Special:ProtectedTitles]]. An option in the drop-down box 'Restriction level' and in brackets after each page name entry.
right-extendedconfirmed:
{{doc-right|extendedconfirmed}}
Refers to a protection level (in use on the English Wikipedia, namely the "extended confirmed users".
restriction-level-extendedconfirmed: Used on [[Special:ProtectedPages]] and [[Special:ProtectedTitles]]. An option in the drop-down box 'Restriction level' and in brackets after each page name entry.
action-editeditorprotected:
{{doc-action|editeditorprotected}}


Copy <nowiki>{{int:protect-level-editeditorprotected}}</nowiki> as is. protect-level-editeditorprotected will be expanded to {{msg-mw|protect-level-editeditorprotected}}.
restriction-level-editeditorprotected: Used on [[Special:ProtectedPages]] and [[Special:ProtectedTitles]]. An option in the drop-down box 'Restriction level' and in brackets after each page name entry.
action-editextendedsemiprotected:
{{doc-action|editextendedsemiprotected}}

Copy <nowiki>{{int:protect-level-editextendedsemiprotected}}</nowiki> as is. protect-level-editeditorprotected will be expanded to {{msg-mw|protect-level-editextendedsemiprotected}}.
protect-level-editextendedsemiprotected: Used as protect level. See also {{msg-mw|Group-autopatrolled}}, {{msg-mw|Group-autopatrolled-member}}
restriction-level-editextendedsemiprotec: Used on [[Special:ProtectedPages]] and [[Special:ProtectedTitles]]. An option in the drop-down box 'Restriction level' and in brackets after each page name entry.
protect-level-banner-protect:
{{notranslate}}
Description of a protection level, used in protection log entries and in form to set protection levels. See also {{msg-mw|group-centralnoticeadmin}}, {{msg-mw|group-centralnoticeadmin-member}}, {{msg-mw|group-translationadmin}} & {{msg-mw|group-translationadmin-member}}
restriction-level-banner-protect:
{{notranslate}}
Used on [[Special:ProtectedPages]] and [[Special:ProtectedTitles]]. An option in the drop-down box 'Restriction level'.
eri-rcfilters-tour-intro-welcome-title: Title of the first step of the guided tour introducing the new Recent Changes filtering features. Also shown on Watchlist.
eri-rcfilters-tour-intro-welcome-descrip:
Description of the first step of the guided tour introducing the new Recent Changes filtering features, if machine learning tools are available on this wiki. Also shown on Watchlist.

Parameters:
$1 - Link to the Enhanced Filters help page
eri-rcfilters-tour-intro-welcome-no-ores:
Description of the first step of the guided tour introducing the new Recent Changes filtering features, if machine learning tools are not available on the wiki. Also shown on Watchlist.

Parameters:
$1 - Link to the Enhanced Filters help page
eri-rcfilters-tour-help: Text for the link to the help page of enhanced filters in the guided tour introducing the new Recent Changes filtering features. Also shown on Watchlist.
eri-rcfilters-tour-intro-preferences-des: Description for the second step of the guided tour introducing the new Recent Changes filters, reminding the users they can disable the feature at any time through their preferences.
eri-rcfilters-tour-intro-welcome-button: Text of the button to close the RC/WL filters feature guided tour.
eri-rcfilters-tour-intro-disable-button: Text of the button to instantly opt out of the new filters on Recent Changes or Watchlist.
eri-rcfilters-tour-highlight-title: Title of the first step of the guided tour introducing the RC filters highlight feature.
eri-rcfilters-tour-highlight-description: Description of the first step of the guided tour introducing the RC filters highlight feature.
eri-rcfilters-tour-highlight-button: Text of the button to close the RC filters highlight feature guided tour.
eri-rcfilters-tour-confirm-title: Title of the confirmation step after the user has agreed to enable the RC Filters beta feature from the guided tour.
eri-rcfilters-tour-confirm-description: Main text of the confirmation step after the user has agreed to enable the RC Filters beta feature from the guided tour.
eri-wlfilters-tour-intro-welcome-title: Title of the first step of the guided tour introducing the new Watchlist filtering features.
eri-wlfilters-tour-intro-preferences-des: Description for the second step of the guided tour introducing the new Watchlist filters, reminding the users they can disable the feature at any time through their preferences.
wikimedia-centralauth-contribs-locked:
This is displayed on [[Special:Contributions]] for locked accounts when we cannot display the log entry. Parameters:
* $1 - the username
right-viewdeletedfile:
{{doc-right|viewdeletedfile}}
Right equivalent to having both {{msg-mw|right-deletedhistory}} and {{msg-mw|right-deletedtext}}, but only in the file and file_talk namespaces.
securepoll-dblist-securepollglobal: Name used in the dropdown on [[Special:SecurePoll/create]] for the list of wikis allowed to vote for Board elections.
wikimedia-statslink:
Text for link to analytics site for the footer on all Wikimedia wikis.

wikimedia-cookiestatement: Text for link to Wikimedia Foundation statement about using [[:w:en:HTTP cookie|web cookies]] on governancewiki for the footer on all Wikimedia wikis.
ext-quicksurveys-performance-internal-su: The question for the perceived performance internal survey
Points to the privacy statement specific to the perceived performance internal survey
wikimedia-switchover-read-only: Text shown during read only period of database switchovers. Used in [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgReadOnly $wgReadOnly].
passwordpolicies-policy-blockattacker: Password policy that has an undisclosed function, and disclosing details would impede the mitigation

technical-maintenance-edit: A message shown during maintenance window when editing is locked
querypage-updates-half-monthly: Text on some special pages with updates twice a month.
querypage-updates-monthly: Text on some special pages with updates once a month.

ext-quicksurveys-internal-gdi-safety-sur:
GDI safety internal survey question.

'''Copy <nowiki>{{SERVERNAME}}</nowiki> as-is, in parentheses.''' It translates automatically to the domain name of the relevant site, for example "es.wikipedia.org" for the Spanish Wikipedia.

The positive answer for the GDI safety internal survey
{{Identical|Yes}}

The negative answer for the GDI safety internal survey
{{Identical|No}}
The neutral answer for the GDI safety internal survey
Points to the privacy statement specific to the GDI safety internal survey
gadget-curidlink-link-by-id: Text of sidebar link added via [[:meta:MediaWiki:Gadget-CurIDLink.js|CurIDLink]] gadget
gadget-curidlink-link-by-id-desc: Text of sidebar tooltip added via [[:meta:MediaWiki:Gadget-CurIDLink.js|CurIDLink]] gadget
gadget-souspages-subpages:
Text of sidebar link added via [[:meta:MediaWiki:Gadget-SousPages.js|SousPages]] gadget

{{Identical|Subpage}}
ext-campaignevents-register-policy: Legal disclaimer shown when a user tries to register for an event. The word for "Registration" should be consistent with the word used in the messages for the Campaign Events extension, for example {{msg-mw|Campaignevents-register-confirmation-top}}.
ext-campaignevents-registration-form-pol: Policy message shown in the footer of the registration form at [[Special:EnableEventRegistration]] and [[Special:EditEventRegistration]].
ext-quicksurveys-similareditors-survey-p: Legal disclaimer in the feedback survey on [[Special:SimilarEditors]]
readinglists-import-app: Prompt user to download app to import reading list.
readinglists-list-empty-message: Prompt user that they can populate their list with the app.
research-incentive-confirm-msg:
{{optional}}

Confirmation acknowledgment for the Research Incentive survey.
ipinfo-global-contributions-url:
URL for Global Contributions link

Parameters:
* $1 - IP address
ipinfo-xtools-url:
URL for XTools link

Parameters:
* $1 - IP address
* $2 - server name of current wiki
protect-level-edit-legal:
{{optional}}
Used as a special protect level in the [https://foundation.wikimedia.org Wikimedia Foundation Governance Wiki].
restriction-level-edit-legal:
{{optional}}
Used in [[Special:ProtectedPages]] and [[Special:ProtectedTitles]] in the [https://foundation.wikimedia.org Wikimedia Foundation Governance Wiki]. An option in the drop-down box 'Restriction level' and in brackets after each page name entry.
wikimedia-babellink-label:
{{optional}}
Label links to for Babel noticeboards found on Wikimedia projects, used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-foundation-projects-label: String commonly used in navigation or headers for content related to Wikimedia Foundation projects
wikimedia-foundation-projects-of-label-l:
String commonly used in navigation or headers for content related to Wikimedia Foundation projects with a link to the official [https://wikimediafoundation.org Wikimedia Foundation website]

Parameters:
* $1 - Link to the official [https://wikimediafoundation.org Wikimedia Foundation website]
wikimedia-foundation-projects-of-label-n: String commonly used in navigation or headers for content related to Wikimedia Foundation projects
wikimedia-projects-label: String commonly used in navigation or headers for content related to Wikimedia projects
wikimedia-mailservices-label: Label for Wikimedia Mailservices, used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-mailservices-tagline: Tagline for Wikimedia Mailservices, used in navigation and labels.
wikimedia-movement-affiliates-label: Label for Wikimedia Movement Affiliates, used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-movement-affiliates-shortlabel: Shorter label for Wikimedia Movement Affiliates, used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-movement-affiliates-oneword: One word label for Wikimedia Movement Affiliates, used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-news-label: Label for Wikimedia movement related news, used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-foundation-news-label: Label for Wikimedia Foundation related news, used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-movement-blog-label: Label for blog about the Wikimedia movement, used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-movement-calendar-label: Label for events calendar specific to the Wikimedia movement, used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-help-translate-prompt:
Prompt to ask for reader to help with translation of content displayed

Parameters:
* $1 - URL to provide translations
wikimedia-foundation-memory-bank-label: Label for Wikimedia Foundation Memory Bank - organization's initiative for documenting historical materials, used in navigation or headers. See [[:foundation:Memory:Main]].
wikimedia-foundation-memory-bank-shortla: Shorter label for Wikimedia Foundation Memory Bank - organization's initiative for documenting historical materials, used in navigation or headers. See [[:foundation:Memory:Main]].
wikimedia-foundation-logo-label: Label for the [[commonswiki:File:Wikimedia Foundation logo - horizontal.svg|Wikimedia Foundation logo]] - used in captions, navigation, or headers
wikimedia-foundation-mark-label: Label for the [[commonswiki:File:Wikimedia-logo black.svg|Wikimedia Foundation mark]] - used in captions, navigation, or headers
wikimedia-foundation-department-shortnam: Short label for name of Wikimedia Foundation's Advancement (fundraising) department - used in captions, navigation, or headers
Short label for name of Wikimedia Foundation's Office of the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) department - used in captions, navigation, or headers
Short label for name of Wikimedia Foundation's Communications department - used in captions, navigation, or headers
Short label for name of Wikimedia Foundation's Finance and Administration department - used in captions, navigation, or headers
Short label for name of Wikimedia Foundation's Legal department - used in captions, navigation, or headers
Short label for name of Wikimedia Foundation's Product and Technology (engineering) department - used in captions, navigation, or headers
Short label for name of Wikimedia Foundation's Talent and Culture (human resources) department - used in captions, navigation, or headers
wikimedia-foundation-about-label: Label for content describing the Wikimedia Foundation and/or its activities - used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-foundation-about-label-short: Short label for content describing the Wikimedia Foundation and/or its activities - used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-foundation-contact-label: Label for methods that people can use to contact the Wikimedia Foundation - used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-foundation-contact-label-short: Short label for methods that people can use to contact the Wikimedia Foundation - used in navigation or headers
wikimedia-nutshell-page-intro:
Introduction to a summary - or a '[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/in_a_nutshell in a nutshell]' - of the page's content, used in hatnotes and page introductions

Parameters:
* $1 - Summary provided by page's contributors
wikimedia-nutshell-content-alt-intro:
Introduction to a summary - or a '[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/in_a_nutshell in a nutshell]' - of the page's content, used in hatnotes and page introductions

Parameters:
* $1 - Title for content being summarized
* $2 - Summary provided by page's contributors
wikimedia-nutshell-guideline-intro:
Introduction to a summary - or a '[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/in_a_nutshell in a nutshell]' - of the guideline's content, used in hatnotes and page introductions

Parameters:
* $1 - Summary provided by guideline's contributors
wikimedia-nutshell-policy-intro:
Introduction to a summary - or a '[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/in_a_nutshell in a nutshell]' - of the policy's content, used in hatnotes and page introductions

Parameters:
* $1 - Summary provided by policy's contributors
wikimedia-nutshell-section-intro:
Introduction to a summary - or a '[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/in_a_nutshell in a nutshell]' - of the section's content, used in hatnotes and section introductions

Parameters:
* $1 - Summary provided by section's contributors
wikimedia-talkheader-archives:
Prompt used in hatnotes of talk pages directing people to archives index for older conversations

Parameters:
* $1 - Link to talk page's archive index
wikimedia-talkheader-civility:
Prompt used in hatnotes of talk pages reminding people to be civil and polite

Parameters:
* $1 - Link to wiki's civility policy
wikimedia-talkheader-pageprompt:
String used to explain which page the discussion is about

Parameters:
* $1 - Wikilink to page being discussed
wikimedia-talkheader-signature:
Prompt used in hatnotes of talk pages reminding people to sign their posts. Four tildes (<nowiki>~~~~</nowiki>) should be included.

Parameters:
* $1 - Link to wiki's help page on signatures
wikimedia-questions-label: String commonly used in navigation or headers to indicate where people can seek answers to questions for Wikimedia
wikimedia-foundation-questions-prompt: String commonly used to prompt people for questions for the Wikimedia Foundation
wikimedia-foundation-questions-prompt-wi: String commonly used to prompt people for questions for the Wikimedia Foundation - provides an email address (which should not be translated - but should be included)
wikimedia-foundation-search-label-short: Short label for button or prompt where user can search for content specifically about the Wikimedia Foundation
wikimedia-foundation-footer-description-: Short description of the Wikimedia Foundation used in page or content footers
wikimedia-capacity-development-label-sho: Short label used in headers for Wikimedia and Wikimedia Foundation effort to improve ability of entities or individuals to achieve target goals
wikimedia-movement-resources-label-short: Short label used in headers for resources specific to entities and individuals within the Wikimedia movement
wikimedia-translation-disclaimer-nolink: Disclaimer for page headers or footers indicating that if the reader is reading a translated version of the page, to refer to the English version of the page's content for the official version of the content
wikimedia-translation-disclaimer-withlin:
Disclaimer for page headers or footers indicating that if the reader is reading a translated version of the page, to refer to the English version of the page's content for the official version of the content - displayed with a link to the English version of the page's content

Parameters:
* $1 - Link to the English version of the page's content
wikimedia-foundation-staffdisclaimer-use: Disclaimer used on user pages of Wikimedia Foundation staff to clarify edits are their own and may not reflect the Foundation itself
wikimedia-talk-archive-page-intro:
Introduction to a page containing archives of an active discussion page with request to post new content to active discussion page

Parameters:
* $1 - Link to the active discussion page
